title.narrative: Reducir al mínimo los riesgos de exposición de los Bifenilos Policlorados (PCB) en las personas y en el medio ambiente de Costa Rica, disminuyendo barreras y logrando gestión racional de PCB.

description.narrative: Reducir al mínimo los riesgos de exposición de los Bifenilos Policlorados (PCB) en las personas y en el medio ambiente de Costa Rica, disminuyendo barreras y logrando gestión racional de PCB.
capital of a political entity
Awareness raising and communication
Number of Awareness raising and communications strategies developed

comment.narrative: Currently no awareness raising and communication strategy has been developed regarding PCBs and the risk it poses to the people and the environment
1 Awareness raising strategy developed and implemented with the main stakeholders electrical sector companies regulating institutions and general public

Printed material was designed as part of the communication strategy Materials such as poster and brochures with best practices of PCB management and sample taking This will be distribuited to all companies and public institutions involved in hazardous waste management compliance
Once the PCB Regulation has been approved and published some of the actions developed in the communication strategy will be implemented to reach the private sector PCB owners to incorporate them in the National PCB Inventory Recently the Chamber of Industries has met with this project coordination to implement an awareness raising strategy among its members
1 Awareness raising strategy developed and implemented with the main stakeholders electrical sector companies regulating institutions and general public

Printed material was designed as part of the communication strategy Materials such as poster and brochures with best practices of PCB management and sample taking This will be distribuited to all companies and public institutions involved in hazardous waste management compliance
Once the PCB Regulation has been approved and published some of the actions developed in the communication strategy will be implemented to reach the private sector PCB owners to incorporate them in the National PCB Inventory Recently the Chamber of Industries has met with this project coordination to implement an awareness raising strategy among its members

description.narrative: Number of workshops with populations living close to Interim storagetransfer station

comment.narrative: Physical location of interim storagetransfer station has not yet been determined and therefore no communication exists with potentially affected population

4 Community workshops carried out for population living close to the interim storagetransfer station to inform about the benefits of interim storagetransfer station in terms of environmental protection and technical safeguards put in place for the operation Regular workshops on a yearly basis as follow up this activity
Since the interim storage transfer station will not be built this output will not be completed

4 Community workshops carried out for population living close to the interim storagetransfer station to inform about the benefits of interim storagetransfer station in terms of environmental protection and technical safeguards put in place for the operation Regular workshops on a yearly basis as follow up this activity
Since the interim storage transfer station will not be built this output will not be completed

description.narrative: Environmentally sound destruction of PCBs and management of contaminated equipment
Number of feasibility studies to determine if low concentration PCB oils s can be destroyed locally

comment.narrative: Low concentration PCB oils cannot be destroyed locally and no study has been conducted to evaluate the feasibility
1 study to determine if PCB contaminated oils with less than 5000 ppm are destroyed locally where ODS will be destroyed

An initiative is being developed between the MINAE Ozone Protection Project and a cement company for the elimination of ODS There have been positive results and an open mind on the part of the cement company for ODS but the issue of PCB oil incineration for concentrations above 5000 ppm was directly addressed and they indicated that they would not be interested in anything but under 50 ppm disposal
1 study to determine if PCB contaminated oils with less than 5000 ppm are destroyed locally where ODS will be destroyed

An initiative is being developed between the MINAE Ozone Protection Project and a cement company for the elimination of ODS There have been positive results and an open mind on the part of the cement company for ODS but the issue of PCB oil incineration for concentrations above 5000 ppm was directly addressed and they indicated that they would not be interested in anything but under 50 ppm disposal

description.narrative: Number of agreements between PCBs holders to develop interim storagetransfer station

comment.narrative: No formal agreement exists among the 7 PCB holders in the country
Public Private Partnership developed for the interim storagetransfer station administration 1 agreement reached between interested parties regarding interim storagetransfer station operation

There were no agreements developed because of the change in the decision to not build an interim storage transfer station In its place the project coordination and technical team has worked closely with the companies in the implementing measures to upgrading their storage facilities to secure enviromentally safe management of their PCB contaminated oils and equipment
Another important aspect considered in the decision making process to not continue with the building of the interim storage transfer station was that the amount of PCB contaminated equipment and oils found is by far less than what was originally expected to be found It was decided that an direct decontaminationelimination process through a tender process was more cost effective
Public Private Partnership developed for the interim storagetransfer station administration 1 agreement reached between interested parties regarding interim storagetransfer station operation

There were no agreements developed because of the change in the decision to not build an interim storage transfer station In its place the project coordination and technical team has worked closely with the companies in the implementing measures to upgrading their storage facilities to secure enviromentally safe management of their PCB contaminated oils and equipment
Another important aspect considered in the decision making process to not continue with the building of the interim storage transfer station was that the amount of PCB contaminated equipment and oils found is by far less than what was originally expected to be found It was decided that an direct decontaminationelimination process through a tender process was more cost effective

description.narrative: National Coordination mechanism established among PCB holders and government companies in operation

comment.narrative: The only option for the decontamination treatment and disposal of PCB contaminated equipment and oils is through exportation to installations at very high cost
National Coordination mechanism operating

Steering Committee is active it holds annual meetings and the Technical Advisory Committee holds monthly meetings The National Coordination mechanism is made up of these two entities Project team complete including National Coordinator Technical Leader and three officials from DIGECA Dirección de Gestión de Calidad Ambiental
National Coordination mechanism operating

Steering Committee is active it holds annual meetings and the Technical Advisory Committee holds monthly meetings The National Coordination mechanism is made up of these two entities Project team complete including National Coordinator Technical Leader and three officials from DIGECA Dirección de Gestión de Calidad Ambiental

description.narrative: Environmentally sound destruction of existing PCB inventory

comment.narrative: There is no technically and economically viable alternative to exporting which needs to be developed in order for the PCB owners to complete the elimination process and fulfill the Stockholm Convention goals
A feasibility study completed to determine the best available technological alternative and the interim storagetransfer station options

Instead of completing a feasibility study to determine the most appropiate technology for destruction and considering that the technical options for such a small inventory are already available on the market in December 2015 several companies with different technological alternative to PCB decontamination and elimination were invited to present their options This activitiy broadened the PCB holders information regarding possible decontamination elimination alternatives
A public tender for decontamination and elimination of identified PCB inventory has been published and is in the process of being awarded The total amount to be destroyed is approximately 100 TM of oil equipment and contaminated wastes
A feasibility study completed to determine the best available technological alternative and the interim storagetransfer station options

Instead of completing a feasibility study to determine the most appropiate technology for destruction and considering that the technical options for such a small inventory are already available on the market in December 2015 several companies with different technological alternative to PCB decontamination and elimination were invited to present their options This activitiy broadened the PCB holders information regarding possible decontamination elimination alternatives
A public tender for decontamination and elimination of identified PCB inventory has been published and is in the process of being awarded The total amount to be destroyed is approximately 100 TM of oil equipment and contaminated wastes

description.narrative: Technical standards for the environmentally sound management of PCBs approved

comment.narrative: No guidelines and technical standards are currently being used
7 PCB owners with management plans presented to regulating institution and compliance verified

The specific PCB Technical Guidelines that were publised at the beginning of 2016 are being implemented by the companies and are available on the Ministry of Environment Website
The PCB regulation that will be approved shortly has the new requirements that specific PCB management will require additional to the general hazardous waste management regulations that already exist The regulation states that these existing regulations are the basis for this new one The main elements of compliance are identification of PCB contaminated equipment and oils reporting of transformers and contaminated inventories in the informatoin system and the obligation to eliminate before 2028
7 PCB owners with management plans presented to regulating institution and compliance verified

The specific PCB Technical Guidelines that were publised at the beginning of 2016 are being implemented by the companies and are available on the Ministry of Environment Website
The PCB regulation that will be approved shortly has the new requirements that specific PCB management will require additional to the general hazardous waste management regulations that already exist The regulation states that these existing regulations are the basis for this new one The main elements of compliance are identification of PCB contaminated equipment and oils reporting of transformers and contaminated inventories in the informatoin system and the obligation to eliminate before 2028

comment.narrative: No trainers trained

description.narrative: Number of Occupational health and safety guidelines issued and implemented by electrical sector companies

comment.narrative: Occupational health and safety issues are important when evaluating potential risk for workers who have already been exposed to PCBs in the past and to prevent future incidents
1 set of Guidelines and technical standards for management of PCB equipment established and implemented transportation storage management and disposal
The technical guidelines on environmental sound management of PCB were published distribuited and placed on Ministry of Environment website
1 set of Guidelines and technical standards for management of PCB equipment established and implemented transportation storage management and disposal

description.narrative: Number of Electrical sector companies with PCB management plans developed and presented to national authority for approval

comment.narrative: There is a lack of a national environmental management plan that includes an elimination plan so that electrical companies can use as guidelines for their activities regarding their PCB issues
PCB environmentally sound management practices implemented in at least 7 electrical sector companies

The project implemented a consultancy to evaluate the PCB storage sites within the electrical sector companies Through this process of evaluation recommendations were made and proper practices were explained to the maintenance personnel Based on the existing techincal guidelines and the consultancy recommendations the project will support with the purchase of some storage equipment container pallets and Emergency Response Equipment as well as paint sealants for storage floors
PCB environmentally sound management practices implemented in at least 7 electrical sector companies

The project implemented a consultancy to evaluate the PCB storage sites within the electrical sector companies Through this process of evaluation recommendations were made and proper practices were explained to the maintenance personnel Based on the existing techincal guidelines and the consultancy recommendations the project will support with the purchase of some storage equipment container pallets and Emergency Response Equipment as well as paint sealants for storage floors

description.narrative: Minimize risks of exposure from PCBs to people and the environment in Costa Rica

Quantity of PCBs liquids and solids destroyed in the project period 20132017
Quantity of PCB material safeguarded

comment.narrative:
1000 MT PCBs destroyed pre project through exports and incountry treatment
National inventory but outdated

1350 MT of PCBs liquids and solids disposed of in an environmentally sound manner
All known PCBs safely stockpiled

At 30 June 2016 1134 TM of oil and equipment were decontaminated The last report indicated 112 TM of oil and equipment were decontaminated and in the second semester of 2015 two companies decontaminated a total of 14 TM of oil and equipment
A public tender for decontamination and elimination of identified PCB inventory has been published and is in the process of being awarded The total amount to be destroyed is approximately 100 TM of oil equipment and contaminated wastes
An electrical maintenance company was hired to identify PCB contaminated equipment owned by public institutions As a first step 200 institutions were visited and information of equipment plates were collected and analyzed Then 70 oil samples were taken and submitted to an acredited laboratory in Canada SDMyers to be analyzed None of them contained more than 50 ppm of PCB
In an effort to verify the results of L2000DX analysis of potentially contaminated equipment that each company had we sent a total of approximately 600 samples to be analyzed by cromatography to SDMyers These results were very helpful in being able to define the equipment and oils that were included in the tender process presently being awarded

1350 MT of PCBs liquids and solids disposed of in an environmentally sound manner
All known PCBs safely stockpiled

At 30 June 2016 1134 TM of oil and equipment were decontaminated The last report indicated 112 TM of oil and equipment were decontaminated and in the second semester of 2015 two companies decontaminated a total of 14 TM of oil and equipment
A public tender for decontamination and elimination of identified PCB inventory has been published and is in the process of being awarded The total amount to be destroyed is approximately 100 TM of oil equipment and contaminated wastes
An electrical maintenance company was hired to identify PCB contaminated equipment owned by public institutions As a first step 200 institutions were visited and information of equipment plates were collected and analyzed Then 70 oil samples were taken and submitted to an acredited laboratory in Canada SDMyers to be analyzed None of them contained more than 50 ppm of PCB
In an effort to verify the results of L2000DX analysis of potentially contaminated equipment that each company had we sent a total of approximately 600 samples to be analyzed by cromatography to SDMyers These results were very helpful in being able to define the equipment and oils that were included in the tender process presently being awarded

description.narrative: Number of environmental health and customs authorities personnel trained to monitor compliance of Stockholm Convention requirements and national norms

comment.narrative: Environmental health and customs authorities personnel do not have the knowledge and training to execute control and monitoring of the PCB stockpiles in the country

30 officials of the environmental health and commerce authorities trained to control the commerce storage transport treatment and final disposal of PCBs 1 Norm developed and validated 4 guidelines manuals developed by end of the project

The technical guidelines on environmental sound management of PCB were published distribuited and placed on Ministry of Environment website
Three officials of the Ministry of Environment were trained in the use of L2000 DX analytical equipment and the interpretation of the results Furthermore in 2016 a chemist of Ministry of Environment staff was sent to a Stockholm Convention Regional Center CETESBI in Sao Paulo Brazil for a specialized course in PCB management This same chemist also assisted to a transformer seminar organized by a private transformer management company ITECNA
The Norm on identification and elimination of PCB was approved by the Ministry of Health and by Ministry of Economy Industry and Commenrce and its waiting ministerial signature

The Norm on identification and elimination of PCB was approved by the Ministry of Health and by Ministry of Economy Industry and Commenrce and its waiting ministerial signature

description.narrative: Strengthened Institutional Capacity in Costa Rica for the environmentally sound management of PCBs
Number of inspections carried out during project implementation 201317

comment.narrative: Currently contaminated sites have not been identified The national inventory was done in 2005 and was based on out of service equipment and primarily with ClorN Oil testing
At least1 inspection made by inspectors to each electrical sector company per semester

In spite of not having the PCB regulation approved officials from the Ministry of Environment visited 8 electrical companies facilities during this period The visits aimed to discuss the recomendations given by the consultant for the improvement of the storage conditions
At least1 inspection made by inspectors to each electrical sector company per semester

In spite of not having the PCB regulation approved officials from the Ministry of Environment visited 8 electrical companies facilities during this period The visits aimed to discuss the recomendations given by the consultant for the improvement of the storage conditions

description.narrative: Number of potential contaminated sites Number of national inventories updated on line with information from electrical companies on contaminated equipment and oils identified and inventories eliminated

comment.narrative: Currently one annual report is submitted to the SC Secretariat
A preliminary inventory of potentially PCB contaminated sites PCB data base operating with on line reporting from electrical sector companies with inventory update information

A consultant company conducted a preliminary inventory of potentially PCB contaminated sites 8 electrical companies participated in the study 11 sites were studied in each one a hydrogeological conceptual model was developed 101 soil samples were taken and then analyzed by L2000 analytical method according to this screening method 6 of the samples have more than 50 ppm of PCB The results were presented in a workshop in December 2015 This preliminary study suggested that 6 sites could be contaminated further chromatography analysis should be made to confirm the results
An IT company was hired to design useful reports and to improve the PCB information system This project is in progress
A preliminary inventory of potentially PCB contaminated sites PCB data base operating with on line reporting from electrical sector companies with inventory update information

A consultant company conducted a preliminary inventory of potentially PCB contaminated sites 8 electrical companies participated in the study 11 sites were studied in each one a hydrogeological conceptual model was developed 101 soil samples were taken and then analyzed by L2000 analytical method according to this screening method 6 of the samples have more than 50 ppm of PCB The results were presented in a workshop in December 2015 This preliminary study suggested that 6 sites could be contaminated further chromatography analysis should be made to confirm the results
An IT company was hired to design useful reports and to improve the PCB information system This project is in progress

description.narrative: Number of PCB management regulations developed and validated by regulating institution

comment.narrative: PCB management is not established by regulations and norms that guarantee their environmentally sound management
PCB management regulations and environmentally sound management norms developed and validated

One regulation Regulation for the identification and environmentally safe elimination of PCB has been technically approved by the Ministry of Health cosigner and the Ministry of Economy Industry and Commerce Official signatures are in process and its publication is expected by December 2016
PCB management regulations and environmentally sound management norms developed and validated

One regulation Regulation for the identification and environmentally safe elimination of PCB has been technically approved by the Ministry of Health cosigner and the Ministry of Economy Industry and Commerce Official signatures are in process and its publication is expected by December 2016

description.narrative: Number of inspectors trained to conduct site visits for the verification of compliance of the regulations for PCB management

comment.narrative: The regulating institution does not have trained inspectors that can evaluate the environmentally sound management of PCBs
At least 4 inspectors trained in PCB management evaluation and enforcement

In 2016 a chemist of Ministry of Environment staff was sent to a Stockholm Convention Regional Center CETESBI in Sao Paulo Brazil for a specialized course in PCB management This same chemist also assisted to a transformer seminar organized by a private transformer management company ITECNA
In total 3 officials from Dirección de Gestión de Calidad Ambiental DIGECA has been trained in general PCB management concepts the use of L2000 analytical equipment and sample taking
At least 4 inspectors trained in PCB management evaluation and enforcement

In total 3 officials from Dirección de Gestión de Calidad Ambiental DIGECA has been trained in general PCB management concepts the use of L2000 analytical equipment and sample taking

description.narrative: • Número de regulaciones de manejo de PCB desarrollado y validado por la institución reguladora. • Número de inventarios nacionales actualizados en línea con información de las empresas eléctricas sobre equipos y aceites contaminados los cuales han sido identificados y eliminados de los inventarios. • Número de informes presentados a la Secretaría del Convenio de Estocolmo • Número de empresas del sector eléctrico con planes de gestión de PCB, desarrollados y presentados a la autoridad nacional competente para su aprobación. • Número de directrices y normas técnicas aprobadas para la gestión ambientalmente racional de los PCB. • Número de normas de seguridad y salud ocupacionales expedidas y ejecutadas por las empresas del sector eléctrico. • Mecanismo nacional de coordinación establecido entre los dueños de PCB y empresas gubernamentales en funcionamiento. • Número de estrategias de sensibilización y de comunicación desarrolladas. • Número de documentos de evaluación y monitoreo de alta calidad elaborados durante la ejecución del proyecto

comment.narrative: • El manejo de los PCB no está establecido por reglamentos y normas que garanticen su manejo ambientalmente racional. • Las cuestiones de salud y seguridad ocupacional son importantes al evaluar el riesgo potencial para los trabajadores que ya han sido expuestos a los PCB en el pasado y para prevenir futuros incidentes • No existe un acuerdo formal entre los 7 titulares de PCB que hay en el país. • Actualmente no se ha desarrollado concienciación ni estrategia de comunicación con respecto a los PCB y el riesgo que supone para las personas y el medio ambiente • No hay documentos sobre la situación inicial.

1. Fortalecimiento la capacidad institucional en Costa Rica para el manejo ambientalmente racional de los PCB (Norma de gestión de PCB desarrollada y validada. Al menos 4 inspectores capacitados.Al menos una inspección semestral realizada a cada empresa. Base de datos de PCB operando en línea. Un inventario preliminar de sitios potencialmente contaminados). 2. Manejo ambientalmente racional y almacenamiento provisional de los PCB (Prácticas de gestión ambientalmente racional de los PCB implementadas en por lo menos 7 empresas del sector eléctrico.capacitados en las mejores prácticas para la gestión de PCB) 3. Destrucción ambientalmente racional de los PCBs y el manejo del equipo contaminado. Capacidad analítica de PCB mejorada 4.Alternativa ambientalmente racional para la descontaminación 5. Sensibilización y comunicación 6. Evaluación Final

1. Se brindó fortalecimiento institucional, dotando a las entidades seleccionadas, de equipo de L2000, reactivos, Equipo de protección personal, análisis de cromatografías, entre otras. Se logró el desarrollo Decreto Ejecutivo N°40697-MINAE-S, Reglamento para la identificación y eliminación ambientalmente segura de los Bifenilos Policlorados. Se logró completar la inventario preliminar de sistios potencialmente contaminados. 2. Se logró capacitar una gran cantidad de personas y empresas, en terminos de Buenas Práctias para la gestión de los PCB. 3. Se concretó la eliminación de los equipos y aceites encontrados contaminados con PCB. Inventario de equipo y desechos completo para eliminación. Se realizó la 2nda. prueba inter-laboratorial 4.Tratamiento y desecho de equipos y aceites contaminados a disposición de las empresas del sector eléctrico y otros propietarios de PCB. 5. Estrategia de sensibilización desarrollada e implementada con los principales actores (empresas del sector eléctrico, instituciones reguladoras y el público en general 6. Se concretó la evaluación final del proyecto
- Identificación de equipos contaminados en manos de propietarios privados. - 100% Inventario en piso eliminado. - Documentación de proceso de eliminación

1. Se está en el proceso de desarrollo una labor tipo call center con el objetivo de llamar a cada propietario privado e institución. Se les manda un correo informativo y luego un seguimiento por teléfono. El equipo de 2 personas contratadas bajo la modalidad de CI ha resultado ser exitoso y tiene resultados positivos en el número de empresas que se han registrado. 2. Ya se han recibido los certificados de destrucción de la empresa gestora y estamos en el proceso de entregarlos a las empresas eléctricas. Ya los dos últimos pagos fueron realizados. 3. Los propietarios privados e instituciones públicas están en el proceso de inscripción en el sistema de información y su base de datos como parte de obligación indicada en el decreto 40697 recientemente aprobado. Se han realizado capacitaciones y puesto en línea documentos fundamentales como: manual del usuario, preguntas frecuentes, el reglamento y la capacitación sobre el uso del sistema. 4. Se ha elaborado una estrategia de sostenibilidad basado en la implementación del reglamento como eje del trabajo de seguimiento del tema de la gestión de PCB por parte de DIGECA. La misma ha sido socializada con la Dirección del proyecto y el Comité Técnico Interno para su aplicación en este 2018. 5. Se han visitados a varias empresas o grupo empresariales con la colaboración de la empresa eléctrica que suministra la energía.
